<p><object data="http://www.twitch.tv/widgets/archive_embed_player.swf" height="378" id="clip_embed_player_flash" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="420"><param name="movie" value="http://www.twitch.tv/widgets/archive_embed_player.swf"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><param name="allowNetworking" value="all"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="flashvars" value="title=KPE2%2B-%2BDay%2BThree%2B%2528Tanuki%252C%2BTheSolarGamer%252C%2BChickenKeeper%252C%2BGoldFish%2529%2B%255Btiny.cc%252Fkpe2%255D&channel=hocgaming&auto_play=false&start_volume=25&archive_id=555868410"></object></p>

<p>Today’s FanWork Fridays is FanWork of a different sort. In the past few days that <a href="http://www.twitch.tv/hocgaming"><strong>HOCgaming</strong></a>'s Kerbal Polar Expedition 2 has been streaming live on Twitch, he and his many entertaining guests have managed to raise over $15,000 for <a href="http://www.charitywater.org/"><strong>charity: water</strong></a>. Helping to save humanity though <em>KSP</em>? Now that’s what we call FanWork.</p>

<p>KPE 2 carries on throughout the weekend. Max and Mu will be stopping by, too! You can watch on <a href="http://www.twitch.tv/hocgaming"><strong>HARV’S CHANNEL</strong></a>, as well as <a href="http://www.twitch.tv/ksptv"><strong>KSP-TV</strong></a>. You can contribute to charity:water by clicking <a href="https://my.charitywater.org/kerbal-polar-expedition-2"><strong>HERE</strong></a>.</p>
